text: It’s so hard to do anything in Haskell, that I get a euphoria every time I remember when to put parentheses around things.

elements.text: It’s so hard to do anything in Haskell, that I get a euphoria every time I remember when to put parentheses around things.

text: once you get the hang of it its actually really productive, but yea once you need something you know very well in another language, especially if it's imperitive, I get super annoyed lol.

elements.text: once you get the hang of it its actually really productive, but yea once you need something you know very well in another language, especially if it's imperitive, I get super annoyed lol.

text: like sometimes I don't want to think of some intense recursion monad thing... Sometimes I want a for-loop lol

elements.text: like sometimes I don't want to think of some intense recursion monad thing... Sometimes I want a for-loop lol

text: the pattern matching though... super nice.

elements.text: the pattern matching though... super nice.

text: Haskell is what you want to use if you want to feel smart after solving your problem. Julia is what you use if you want to feel smart while you're solving the problem.

elements.text: Haskell is what you want to use if you want to feel smart after solving your problem. Julia is what you use if you want to feel smart while you're solving the problem.

text: Rust is kind of similar to Haskell in that regard, except I don't think Rust makes me feel smart, just that mild joy of like "oh hey this thing runs" after randomly churning &, mut, and * all over the variables available
